According to Ken Auletta 's sources, Eric Schmidt 's appetite for the job waned not because of the China decision, but because Google was struggling to deal with the success of Facebook and increased scrutiny from regulators. Google was becoming defensive. All of their social-network efforts had faltered. Facebook had replaced them as the hot tech company, the place vital engineers wanted to work, Ken Auletta writes." Complaints about Google bureaucracy intensified. Governments around the world were lobbing grenades at Google over privacy, copyright, and size issues.
